meanings.sent1: The old washing machine would judder loudly during the spin cycle.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused the ground to judder beneath our feet.
meanings.sent3: The juddering train made everyone's coffee spill!
meanings.sent4: His heart juddered with fear as he approached the dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The thunder made the windows judder in their frames.

meanings.definition: (noun) A sudden, strong shaking or vibration.
meanings.sent1: The judder of the explosion could be felt miles away.
meanings.sent2: The judder of the train passing by startled the birds.
meanings.sent3: The judder of the roller coaster made her scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The judder of the impact knocked the vase off the table.
meanings.sent5: The judder of the engine signaled the start of the race.
